SLO-2.Definition: SLO-2 is a member of a multigene family of high-conductance K+ channels1,2. These channels are activated by voltage but differ from the purely voltage-gated K+ channels because their voltage range of activation is modulated by different intracellular fac- tors3. SLO-1 channels are sensitive to Ca2+ (refs. 4–7), and mouse SLO-3 (mSLO-3) channels to pH8. We now report that C. elegans SLO-2 channels are sensitive to Cl– as well as Ca2+.
